page.title: 07STEVENS' MILL BURWELL.
page.content: The{150 year old clunch-built {tower-mill}was used until 1952 when the cap became unsafe.It had fields surrounding it apart from one cottage. In{1965}a group of people formed a trust and bought it for Â£5. They had to put in new beams with steel girders because the others were rotten.They concreted the lowest floor while the other three had new planks.These were made of pitch_pine wood which is no longer available so deal was used instead.The machinery was in good working order but had to be painted and cleaned.The fan-tail has been replaced and the sails will be put back this summer. It is hoped to have{a museum in a {rebuilt barn}on the nearby allotments. This is being brought from outside Burwell.Car-boot sales are held to raise funds.
